metric: Data is updated daily by about 4 p.m. and includes cases reported through the previous day.
Outbreaks are investigated at residential and non-hospital heathcare facilities.
The state rate per 100,000 includes all cases (including cases who have not yet been assigned to a county).

Cases include people who had a positive lab test positive and cases that public health identified and determined were likely to have COVID-19 because of their symptoms and close contact with someone who tested positive. The number of untested cases included in the total case count is a very small portion of the total cases reported.
People who tested positive for COVID-19 in Colorado while visiting are included in the county where they were identified.
County rates per 100,000 are calculated using 2018 population estimates from the Demography Section, Colorado Division of Local Government.
Rates are not shown for counties with fewer than 5 cases.
Caution should be used when interpreting rates in counties with small populations.
Some cases may still be under investigation and county not assigned yet.
Onset date may be unavailable for some cases and inferred.
